1.text: If there is therefore any exhortation in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassion,

2.text: make my joy full, by being like-minded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind;

3.text: doing nothing through rivalry or through conceit, but in humility, each counting others better than himself;

4.text: each of you not just looking to his own things, but each of you also to the things of others.

5.text: Have this in your mind, which was also in Christ Jesus,

6.text: who, existing in the form of God, didn’t consider equality with God a thing to be grasped,

7.text: but emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men.

8.text: And being found in human form, he humbled himself, becoming obedient to death, yes, the death of the cross.

9.text: Therefore God also highly exalted him, and gave to him the name which is above every name;

10.text: that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, those on earth, and those under the earth,

11.text: and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

12.text: So then, my beloved, even as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

13.text: For it is God who works in you both to will and to work, for his good pleasure.

14.text: Do all things without murmurings and disputes,

15.text: that you may become blameless and harmless, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you are seen as lights in the world,

16.text: holding up the word of life; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ, that I didn’t run in vain nor labor in vain.

17.text: Yes, and if I am poured out on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice, and rejoice with you all.

18.text: In the same way, you also rejoice, and rejoice with me.

19.text: But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, that I also may be cheered up when I know how you are doing.

20.text: For I have no one else like-minded, who will truly care about you.

21.text: For they all seek their own, not the things of Jesus Christ.

22.text: But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News.

23.text: Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it will go with me.

24.text: But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly.

25.text: But I counted it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, fellow soldier, and your apostle and servant of my need;

26.text: since he longed for you all, and was very troubled, because you had heard that he was sick.

27.text: For indeed he was sick, nearly to death, but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, that I might not have sorrow on sorrow.

28.text: I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that, when you see him again, you may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

29.text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy, and hold such in honor,

30.text: because for the work of Christ he came near to death, risking his life to supply that which was lacking in your service toward me.
